metadata.title: CVE-2021-47055 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mtd:require write permissions for locking and badblock ioctls MEMLOCK,MEMUNLOCK and OTPLOCK modify protection bits. Thus require writepermission. Depending on the hardware MEMLOCK might even be write-once,e.g. for SPI-NOR flashes with their WP# tied to GND. OTPLOCK is alwayswrite-once. MEMSETBADBLOCK modifies the bad block table.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47055` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2082-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2082.88
